import pandas as pd

import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.offline import iplot

import cufflinks
cufflinks.go_offline()
cufflinks.set_config_file(world_readable=True)
source.461a2f96: #Copied from an Amazing Kernel by Anshur: https://www.kaggle.com/anshuls235/journey-of-ctds-show-through-visuals fig = go.Figure() fig.add_trace(go.Indicator( title = {'text':'Total Submissions Received','font':{'color': 'white'}}, mode = "number", number={'font':{'color': 'white'}}, value = results.Author.count(), domain = {'row': 0, 'column': 0})) fig.add_trace(go.Indicator( title = {'text':'Total Unique Entries','font':{'color': 'white'}}, mode = "number", number={'font':{'color': 'white'}}, value = results.Author.nunique(), domain = {'row': 0, 'column': 1})) fig.add_trace(go.Indicator( title = {'text':'Highest Points Scored','font':{'color': 'white'}}, mode = "number", number={'font':{'color': 'white'}}, value = results.Total.max(), domain = {'row': 1, 'column': 0})) fig.add_trace(go.Indicator( title = {'text':'Average Total Points','font':{'color': 'white'}}, mode = "number", number={'font':{'color': 'white'}}, value = results.Total.mean(), domain = {'row': 1, 'column': 1})) fig.update_layout(width=700,height=400, title = {'text':'CTDS.Show Contest Stats', 'font':{'size':30,'color': '#0062ff'}}, template='seaborn',margin=dict(t=60,b=10,l=10,r=10), grid = {'rows': 2, 'columns': 2, 'pattern': "independent"},paper_bgcolor='#07d7f2')
source.1a19ef8a:
results = results.drop_duplicates(subset='Author', keep="first")

fig_overall = go.Figure()

fig_overall = px.bar(results.drop_duplicates(subset='Author', keep="first").sort_values(by=['Total']), y = "Author", x = "Total",
             title="Overall Leaderboard",
             hover_name = 'Author',
             text='Total',
             orientation='h', 
             width=650, height=1000, range_x = [0, 100])

fig_overall.update_traces(marker_color='#ff9900', textposition="outside")

fig_overall.show()
source.0f7c904c:
results = results.sort_values(by=['Total'],ascending=True)

fig_2 = go.Figure()

for col in results.columns[2:7]:
    fig_2.add_trace(go.Bar(y=results.Author, x=results[col],name=col, orientation='h'))
fig_2.update_layout(barmode='stack',width=650, height=1000)
fig_2.show()
source.2d104328:
categories = results.columns[2:7]

points = results.columns[2:7]

#Overall Winner: Female
fig1 = go.Figure()

fig1.add_trace(go.Scatterpolar(
      r=results[points].loc[3],
      theta=points,
      fill='toself',
      name=results.Author.loc[3]
))

fig1.update_layout(
  polar=dict(
    radialaxis=dict(
      visible=True,
      range=[0, 20]
    )),
  showlegend=False
)

fig1.show()

# CTDS.Show: About

### TOC:

> *Note: This is very much a work in progress, Rohan Rao has suggested that as a challenge, I should maintain a notebook about CTDS.Show Milestones, Challenge accepted!*

> *To remain respectful of the promised timelines for the [CTDS.Show contest](https://www.kaggle.com/rohanrao/chai-time-data-science/discussion/156137) results announcement, the initial version of this kernel might just be a LB from the contest, please excuse the lack of more initial content.*


- **Competition and Results**


[WIP, To be added]:

- [ ] *What is CTDS?*
- [ ] *CTDS Timeline*:
    - [ ] *Evolution from first Recording to 100th recording*
    - [ ] *Busy weeks of Chai*
    - [ ] *Question patterns over Chai: Signs of evolution?*
    - [ ] *Representation % with time: Has CTDS fixed one of the core issues?*
    - [ ] *Will CTDS break 500k Downloads?*
- [ ] *Kaggle and CTDS*:
    - [ ] *Watch Trends across different tiers?*
    - [ ] *Delay in Comp results Vs Watch Trends?*
    - [ ] *Same Qs, different GMs, analysing answers*
- [ ] How does social media affect CTDS:
    - [ ] *Patterns with views and tweets, linkedin posts*
    - [ ] *Patterns with reddit posts*
- [ ] *Changes observed after implementing suggestions from Contest:*
     - [ ] *(Possible) Kaggle Grandmaster Panel Discussion*
     - [ ] *Adding Short snippets*
     - [ ] *Posting the interviews with interesting qoutes on Twitter and Linkedin*
     - [ ] *Posting short snippets to Twitter, Linkedin, Facebook, Reddit*
     - [ ] *Converting interviews to blogposts*
     - [ ] *Changes in watching trends as diversity on the podcast improves*

source.75c26084:
## Categorical Winners:

To recap the categories were set as follows:

- **Presentation**: How well is the notebook written in terms of code quality, text description and grammar?
- **Storytelling**: Is there a natural flow of the story that connects various points?
- **Visualizations**: Are the visualizations appealing, understandable and aligned with description?
- **Insights**: Are the insights relevant, useful and actionable?
- **Innovation**: How novel and creative are the ideas and approaches?

### Process of finalising winners:

The winners were picked based on the categories, in order, exclusive to overall winners and individual winners:

#### Categorical Winner: *Presentation* category:

Congratulations to `ambarish`, Let's take a closer look at the top 5 (remaining) scores:
source.5d23cebc:
#### Categorical Winner: *Innovation* category:

Congratulations to `sahiljuneja`, Let's take a closer look at the top 5 (remaining) scores:
source.22cbdee9:
## Context about the Competition and Results:

The CTDS.Show Contest was run in an effort to celebrate the 1-year anniversary of the podcast and to invite insights from the Kaggle community for the podcast and things that may be improved. This was based on [Grandmaster Rohan Rao](https://www.kaggle.com/rohanrao)'s idea. [Read More about it here](https://www.kaggle.com/rohanrao/chai-time-data-science/discussion/168310#936323). 


After some Chai and brainstorming, the idea of hosting a competition was born, to make the "stars" (actually dates, but that was more dramatic), align, the timelines chosen were:

- Launching the competition on the date when the **first recording** was done.
- In true spirit of the podcast, hosting a few events to encourage participation by all levels of participants.
- Again, Kaggle Hereos and legend Kernel Grandmasters agreed to being judges for the competition!
- Finally, [Parul Pandey](https://www.kaggle.com/parulpandey) and [John Miller](https://www.kaggle.com/jpmiller) shared two amazing kernels on [Getting Started](https://www.kaggle.com/parulpandey/how-to-explore-the-ctds-show-data) and [Some Best Practices for Analytics Reporting](https://www.kaggle.com/jpmiller/some-best-practices-for-analytics-reporting) advices respectively

source.420e2214:
## Overall Winners:

Two Overall Winners were chosen as follows: 
- Maximum points achieved by a Female (Total) would be declared as overall winner.
- Maximum points achieved by a Male (Total) would be declared as overall winner.

#### Overall Winner: Female:

Congratulations to Vrinda Prabhu for winning in this category! 
Let's take a closer look at her scores:
